NavigationActivation.summary: The NavigationActivation interface of the Navigation API represents a recent cross-document navigation. It contains the navigation type and outgoing and inbound document history entries.

remarks.para: This object is accessed via the and properties. Note that, in each case, the NavigationActivation represents a different navigation:

NavigationActivationEntry.summary: The entry read-only property of the interface contains a object representing the history entry for the inbound ("to") document in the navigation. This is equivalent to the property at the moment the inbound document was activated.

remarks.para: There are some cases in which either the from or entry objects would not be viable targets for the traverseTo() method, as they might not be retained in history. For example, the document can be activated using location.replace() or its initial entry could be replaced by history.replaceState(). However, those entries' url properties and getState() methods are still accessible.

NavigationActivationFrom.summary: The from read-only property of the interface contains a object representing the history entry for the outgoing ("from") document in the navigation.
NavigationActivationFrom.value: A object, or null if the outgoing document is:

NavigationActivationNavigationType.summary: The navigationType read-only property of the interface contains a string indicating the type of navigation.
NavigationActivationNavigationType.value: A string representing the type of navigation the relates to. Possible values are:
